Hamilton, Clement Hamilton
 
November 24, 1893
 
July 1978
 
Woodsfield
 
Hamilton, daughter Hamilton
 
 
August 20, 1916
 
Antioch
 
Source: The Marietta Times, Saturday, December 20, 2003
Elsie Mallett , nee Hamilton
LEWISVILLE, Ohio - Elsie Mallett, 84, of 44938 State Route 145, Lewisville, Ohio, died Friday evening (Dec. 19, 2003) at Marietta Memorial Hospital in Marietta.
Arrangements are incomplete at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield.
 
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, dated Thursday, January 1, 2004
Elsie C. Hamilton Mallett, 84, of 44938 SR 145, Lewisville, died December 19, 2003, in Marietta Memorial Hospital, Marietta. She was born in Woodsfield, March 24, 1919, a daughter of the late Homer L. and Marie Christman Hamilton.
She was a 1937 graduate of the former Woodsfield high School in Woodsfield; a homemaker and a member of the Sutherland United Methodist Church, near Lewisville. She was also a member of the VFW ladies Auxiliary Post 5108, where she had served as a past president and was also a member of the Franklin Homemakers Club at Lewisville.
Surviving are two daughters, Mrs. Richard (Vicki) Burton, of Canal Winchester, Kathy Mallett, of Marietta; four brothers, Gerald Hamilton, of Belpre, Gene Hamilton, of Ventura, CA, Arthur Hamilton, of Rotonda West, FL, and Herbert L. Hamilton, of Columbus; three grandchildren, Doug, Mike, and Christy Burton, of Canal Winchester; several nieces and nephews.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Ralph W. Mallett, on August 6, 1994, whom she married January 12, 1947; two sisters, Hilda Smith, Opal Schwall; three brothers, Edwin Hamilton, Willard Hamilton and Ray Hamilton.
Friends were received at Watters Funeral home, Woodsfield, December 22, where funeral services were held December 23, with Reverend Gary Fitzgerald in Sutherland Cemetery, near Lewisville.
 
Hamilton, Ethel R.
September 6, 1914
 
 
Hamilton, Eunice J.
 
February 24, 1920
 
March 14, 2002
Woodsfield
Hamilton, Eunice J.
Source:Marietta Times . . Marietta, OH . . .Mar 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
Woodsfield - Eunice J. Hamilton, 82, of 803 Monroe Manor died at 8:05 a.m. Thursday (March 14, 2002) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center in Woodsfield.
She was born February 24, 1920, near Woodsfield to Thomas and Evaline Wohnhas Hamilton. She was a retired restaurant worker in Columbus and was a member of the Woodsfield Church of Christ in Woodsfield.
She is survived by five sisters, Laura Bach of Lewisville, Gertrude Hamilton and Goldia Hamilton, both of Woodsfield, Geneva Lyons of Columbus, and Sarah Kreig of Sardis; two brothers, Horace Hamilton of Zanesville and Neil Hamilton of Woodsfield; and several nieces and nephews.
She was preceded in death by her parents; and three brothers, Vernon Hamilton, Oscar Hamilton and Thomas Hamilton.
Services are at 1 p.m. Saturday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with Harold Kinney Jr. and Max Winland officiating. Burial is in Fairview Cemetery near Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Hamilton, Harley Emerson
Source:Marietta Times . . . Marietta, OH . . . 10 June 2002
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
Woodsfield - Harley Emerson Hamilton, 77, of 210 Green St. died Sunday morning (June 9, 2002) at Barnesville Hospital in Barnesville.
He was born July 5, 1924, near Woodsfield to Ralph and Ora Bott Hamilton. He was a retired lab technician at the former Conalco Corp. in Hannibal. He was a member of Moffatt-Fletcher United Methodist Church near Woodsfield and was a former member of the Antioch Volunteer Fire Department and Emergency Squad at Antioch.
He is survived by his wife, Martha Lea Williams Hamilton, whom he married on November 12, 1944; two daughters, Carolyn Sue Antill and her husband, James, of Woodsfield, and Judy Mercer and her husband, Bernard, ofBeallsville, Ohio; two sisters, Jean Ackerman of Woodsfield and Doloras Confer of Parkersburg; six grandchildren; five great-grandchildren; and two stepgreat-grandchildren.
Services are at 11 a.m. Wednesday at Watters Funeral Home in Woodsfield with the Rev. James Porter officiating. Burial will be in Fairview Cemetery near Woodsfield. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. Tuesday at the funeral hom

Hamilton, Neil G.
Neil G. Hamilton
 
WOODSFIELD - Neil G. Hamilton, 75, of Woodsfield, died Sunday morning (November. 21, 2004) at his home. He was born June 28, 1929, a son of the late Thomas R. and Eva Wohnhas Hamilton of the Jackson Ridge community.
 
He was a member of St. Paul's United Church of Christ in Woodsfield, a Marine Corps veteran, and retired from the Ohio Department of Transportation.
He was preceded in death by three brothers, Oscar, Vernon, and Thomas W. Hamilton; and one sister, Eunice Hamilton.
 
He is survived by his wife, Shirley Ball Hamilton, whom he married May 1, 1954; four sons, Bud Hamilton and his wife, Judy, Dave Hamilton and his wife, Sharon, and Chuck Hamilton and his wife, Michele, all of Woodsfield, and Thomas E. Hamilton and his wife, Jeanne, of Vincent; one daughter, Becky Hickenbottom and her husband, Marvin, of Barnsville; 10 grandchildren, Kent and Kara Hamilton, Kyle, Cody, and Katy Hickenbottom, Cayla Hamilton, Hogan and Dylan Hamilton, and Jared and Lauren Hamilton; one brother, H.E. "Ham" Hamilton and his wife, Judy, of Zanesville; five sisters, Laura Bach, Gertrude Hamilton, and Goldia Hamilton, all of Woodsfield, Geneva Lyons of Columbus, and Sarah Krieg and her husband, Bernard, of Sardis; and several nieces, nephews, great-nieces, and great-nephews.
Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, where services will be held at 11 a.m. Tuesday (November. 23) with the Rev. Cliff Garris officiating. Burial will be in Oaklawn Cemetery in Woodsfield. Source: Marietta Times, Monday November 22, 2004.

Woodsfield
 
Hammond, Cunthia Ann
Cynthia Ann Hammond and 2 children Mary E. & Isaiah Hammond were admitted to the Infirmary June 13, 1877 by order of the Trustees of Trimble Township. The said Cynthia was born in Monroe County, Ohio & is 45 years old & has been a resident of Athens County for 3 years. Mary E. is 9 years, Isaiah is 6 years. Mrs. Hammond is subject to fits and spasms. R. A. Davis, Supt. Cintha Rutter died January 7, 1878 & her children were taken away by their Father. Page 209, Volume One, Athens County infirmary
 
Handshumach, Valentine
March 13, 1915
 
Haney, Betty Delane, nee Hanlon
April 27, 2004, Marietta Times
WOODSFIELD - Betty Delane Haney, 74, of Woodsfield died Sunday (April 25, 2004) at the Woodsfield Nursing and Rehabilitation Center.
 
She was born March 22, 1930, in New Matamoras to William Hanlon and Evaline Haught Hanlon. She was a member of Moreland First Christian Church of Canton and held numerous offices in Fraternal Order of Eagles 2302 over the years.
She is survived by seven sons, Fredreick and Millie Henthorne Haney of Sardis, Carl and Doris Carpenter Haney of Lower Salem, Robert and Deborah Crum Haney of Newport, Roger and Deborah Love Haney of Lewisville, Marion "Bud" and Tracy Christman Haney of Shadyside; Earl and Barb Robbins Haney of Woodsfield and Ralph and Cathy Koburn Haney Jr. of Oregon, Ohio; five daughters, Karen and Wayne Forshey of Woodsfield, Ruth Schultz and Dave McNeal of Lancaster, Cindy Haney of Statesville, N.C., Judy and David Stoneking of Lower Salem and Janet and Jeff Pickenpaugh of Woodsfield; one sister, Dorthy Fulton of Lower Salem; 32 grandchildren; and 37 great-grandchildren.
 
She was preceded in death by her husband, Ralph F. Haney; her companion, Shirley Workman; three brothers, Emmett, James and Edwin Hanlon; five sisters, Stella Hanlon, Grace Duff, Clara Tice, Bertha Taylor and Mildred Pugh; and one grandson, Joseph Urbanek.
 
Services are at 1 p.m. Wednesday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Lloyd Westbrook officiating. Burial is in Pleasant Ridge Cemetery near Graysville. Friends will be received from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.
 
Memorial contributions may be made to the Pleasant Ridge Cemetery Fund, in care of Willis Anderson, 38965 Church Road, Graysville, Ohio 45734.
 
Highman-Hoover marriage
Source:The Monroe County Beacon, dated, November 28, 1940
Mrs. M. J. Hoover, of Woodsfield, Ohio, announces the marriage of her daughter, Miss Edna Hoover to Mr. Glen Highman, of near Graysville, which was solemnized at Covington, Kentucky, October 19, 1940. The bride was attired in a street length dress of blue crepe with corresponding accessories of blue, while the bridegroom was also dressed in a suit of navy blue. They are making their home in Middletown, Ohio, where the groom has employment. Friends are extending congratulations and best wishes to the happy couple

Hanna, Wilda Hanna

Hannahs, Emma F. Hannahs
 
 
October 1934
 
Hannahs, Lena, nee Huntsman
Published--October 2002
Lena Hannahs, 83, of Barnesville, died Saturday , October 5, 2002, at her residence.
She was born October 24, 1918, in Somerton, a daughter of the late Lester and Myrtle Stephen Huntsman.
She was a retired seamstress and beautician and a member of First Christian Church.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Frank H. Hannahs; three brothers, Francis, Delbert and Roger Huntsman; and a granddaughter, Tammy Jo Crawford.
She leaves a son, Sam (Valerie) Hannahs of Barnesville; a daughter, Mrs. William (Nancy) Crawford of Bethesda; three sisters, Ruby Hannahs, Melbe Swallie and Joan Gallagher, all of Barnesville; six grandchildren, Tina Marie Greenwood and Mark, Mario, Michelle,Amanda,Joaad Nathaniel Hannahs and seven great-grandchildren.
Friends were received Sunday at Campbell-Plumly-Milburn Funeral Home in Barnesville, where services were held Monday with the Rev. Ed. Eberhart officiating. Burial followed in Crestveiw Cemetery in Barnesville.
 
Hannahs, Louis E.
of Louis E. Hannahs
Source:Spirit of Democracy, dated, March 25, 1931
Louis Hannahs , 45 , died Tuesday morning March 24, 1931, at his home near Miltonsburg. He had recently suffered a severe attack of influenza.
Surviving are his widow, three sons and one daughter, besides a host of other relatives and friends who mourn his departure.
A daughter preceded him in about two months ago.
Mr. Hannahs, was one of Malaga Township's well known citizens, was a man of many fine qualities and liked by all who knew him. The bereaved family have the sympathy of the entire community.
Funeral services will be held on Thursday afternoonn from The Valley Church at Calais, where interment will be made.
 

September 14, 1989

Hannahs, Mitchell Linn and Amy Marie Glotzbach

Mr. and Mrs. Leo Glotzbach of Monon, IN are pleased to announce the engagement of their daughter, Amy Marie Glotzbach to Mitchell Linn Hannahs, son of Mr. and Mrs. Marion Hannahs of Lewisville.

Amy is in her senior year at Indiana State University. Mitch is a graduate of Skyvue High School and is completing his degree at Indiana State.

Mitch and Amy are planning a September 15, 1990 wedding at St. Joseph Catholic Church in Reynolds, IN.

Hanson, Chad Eric
Chad Eric Hanson, 31, of Patty Mine Road, Martins Ferry, Ohio, died Sunday, August 8, 2004 at home.
Chad was born December 10, 1972 at Wheeling, W. Va., the son of William R. and Carol Lee Greiner Hanson, also of Martins Ferry.
 
Chad was a 1991 graduate of Martins Ferry High School and a member of Trinity Evangelical Lutheran Church, Bridgeport.
 
He was an employee of the Angelina Stone & Marble Restoration of Lansing.
 
In addition to his mother and father, Chad is also survived by his brothers, Scott (Lorrie) Hanson of Martins Ferry, Todd (Lisa) Hanson of Virginia Beach, Va..; his maternal grandmother, Lucille Greiner of Martins Ferry; three nephews, Joshua, Jared and Jeremy Hanson; two nieces, Sarah and Cassie Hanson.
 
Friends will be received at the Wilson Funeral Home, 920 National Road, Brookside, Ohio on Wednesday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., where services will be held on Thursday at 10 a.m., with the Rev. Everett Hutson, officiating. Interment will follow in Linwood Cemetery, Blaine, Ohio.
 
Memorial contributions in Chad's memory may be made to the Sunset Heights Fire Department, 69604 Sunset Heights, Bridgeport, Ohio 43912.
Source:The Times Leader, Martins Ferry, Ohio, Wednesday, August 11, 2004

Hanson, Isaac

Hanson, Lafe
May 26, 1965
Source:Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
Lafe Hanson , 90 , of Lewisville, a retired carpenter, died Wednesday night, May 26, 1965, at 11:15 o'clock, in Castle Nursing Home, at Millersburg after an extended illness.
He was born May 10, 1875, in Monroe County, son of Isaac and Susan Wilson Hanson, and was a member of Lewisville Methodist Church.
Mr. Hanson lived in Akron twenty years, being a builder and contractor in the Kenmore District.
Surviving are three daughters; Mrs. Edith Boyer, of Erie, Pa.; Mrs. Icel Haws, of Bath and Mrs. Gladys Stewart of North Olmstead; two brothers, Thomas Hanson of Phoenix, Arizona, and M.I. Hanson of Lewisville; a sister, Mrs. Mary Lumbatis, of Lewisville; nine grandchildren, and twenty-three great-grandchildren.
Funeral services were held Sunday afternoon at two o; clock in The Lewisville Methodist Church, with Rev. Ralph Yoss and Rev. Paul Neville officiating. Burial was in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville, with The Gardner Funeral Home, of Woodsfield in charge.

Hanson, William
OBIT: William HANSON [1840OH-1921IN]
[See the attached file]
THE BLOOMFIELD NEWS, Bloomfield, Greene County, Indiana, Thursday, June 2, 1921, Volume XLV, Number 29, Page 1, Column 4, DEATH S HARVEST. Hanson. [Transcribed from Bloomfield-Eastern Greene County Public Library s IHS Microfilm Records.]
William HANSON was born in Noble County, Ohio, October 15, 1840; came to Greene County, Indiana, about fifty-two years ago and settled on a farm near Newark, where he resided until seven years ago, since which time he has made his home with his daughter, Mrs. David Thompson, the greater part of the time, where he died May 21, 1921.
 
He was married to Lucinda FORCHEY November 4, 1862, in Monroe County, Ohio, and to this union were born four sons and two daughters, three of whom died in infancy, and one son died at the age of twenty-two years.
His faithful companion lives to mourn his departure, and who, also is a helpless sufferer, and two daughters, Mrs. Ellen Thompson, near Solsberry, and Mrs. Rebecca KIDD, of Koleen.
One brother also survives Frank HANSON, of Newark and three sisters Amanda RESLER, Newark; Sarah Phillips, Mattoon, Ill; Anna Thompson, Worthington.
He was converted and united with the M. P. Church about forty-five years ago at Newark, under the pastorate of Rev. HUGHES and others. AfterWards he united with the M. E. church at that place. His profession was not loud but sincere and true.
He was eighty-years, seven months and six days of age at the time of his death.
Verily, a true, honest man has gone; a true companion and father. Funeral services were conducted from the home of his daughter, Mrs. David Thompson, by Rev. W. J. ELLIS. Interment in Newark Cemetery, May 23, 1921.
NOTES RLJ: INDEX TO MARRIAGES IN GREENE County, INDIANA, 1933, WPA, Page 54: HANSON, Amanda E. to Oliver A. RESLER, 13 Dec 1882, Book L, Page 534; HANSON, Anna to James E. Thompson, 4 Apr 1893, Book N, Page 456; HANSON, Rebecca W., born 19 Mar 1875, to Herbert F. KIDD, 14 Feb 1920, Book 13, Page 486. (2) CEMETERIES OF EASTERN GREENE County, INDIANA, 1994, G.C.H.S., Newark Cemetery, Page 21: RESLER, Amanda, 23 November 1861 17 October 1944; RESLER, Oliver, 30 October 1861 14 Apr 1990; Solsberry Cemetery, Page40: Thompson, Mary Ellen (HANSON), 16 Feb 1867 1957; Thompson, David Gilbert, s/o Edward & Sallie, 26 Dec 1864 1938;

Hardman, Nellie K. Rotruck
Source--Wetzel Chronical West Virginia
Published--December 23, 1998
Nellie K. Rotruck Hardman, 84, of Paden City Garden Apartments, Paden City , - formerly of
Parkersburg died Friday December. 18, 1998, in New Martinsville. She was a retired employee of Thorne s
Supermarket. Vienna, West Virginia, and was member of the Paden City Christian Church.
She was preceded in death by her parents, Ellsworth and Reatha Frye Rotruck; a brother, Luther Rotruck.
Surviving are a daughter Reatha Goddard of New Martinsville; a sister Pearl Jarrett of Jacksonville
Florida; a grandson, Greg Eddy of Charleston, West Virginia; four granddaughters, Karla Cummins of Akron, Ohio,
Teresa Allen of Sardis, Ohio, Lisa Burroughs of Indianapolis, Indiana., and Angela Drown of Enterprise,
Alabama; three great-grandsons; four great-granddaughters.
Friends were received 7-9 p.m. Saturday, December 19, and noon - three Sunday at the Jarvis Funeral Home, 309 North. Fourth Avenue., Paden City.Final arrangements are incomplete.
Wetzel Chronicle December 23, 1998
 
Haren, Albert T.
1930 census, Albert T. Haren (49) owned a farm worth $2500 in Sunsbury Twp., Monroe County, Ohio. He lived there with his wife Lucy M. (50) and children Claude (18), Bernadine (17), Lucille (13), and Elizabeth (7). Lucille and Elizabeth attended school. The family owned a radio set. Adjacent farms in the census were those of Otto Burkhart and Joseph Hopkins.

Haren, Frederick
Died: March 10, 1914, Source:The Monroe County death records
 
Haren, Fred J.
1920 census: , 67 year old farmer Fred J. Haren lived on a farm that he owned in the 5th precinct of Center Twp., Monroe Co., Ohio with his wife Barbara (63) and children Bertha (23) and Raymond (21). Everyone in the household was born in Ohio. Fred and Barbara's parents were German.
Adjacent farms in the 1920 census belonged to Leo * Barbara Burkhart, and Millard Hubbard. John Haren (57) and his wife Catherine (52) lived nearby.

Harkins, William Nelson
Published--The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio
January 3, 1918
 
Was born in Chester County, Pennsylvania, January 29, 1848, and died December 11, 1917, aged 69 years, 10 months and 23 days.. He was the son of David T. and Sydney Harkins. His parents moved to Ohio when he was about six years old. He was united in marriage with Josephine Coburn, to this union were born two children. His home for a number of years was at Danville, Meigs County, Ohio, but the last twenty years of his life was spent in Vinton County, Ohio. He was a preacher of the gospel for over 30 years. He and his brother D.W. Harkins Started out in the ministery together. He has preached in a number of places in Monroe County and is well known by a number of people in the County. A finer and better man is seldom if ever found. His leaves to mourn his departure, a wife, one daughter and son-in-law and three grandchildren. Two brothers
John W. and D. Wayne and one sister, Mrs. R.E. Devore. He is at rest from his sorrows and pain. Our dear brother has gone to his reWard. May God bless his family. D.W. Harkins
(typed by betty

Harman and Mr. and Mrs. E. Paul Lucas invite you to join them in asking God's blessing upon this holy union at two-thirty in the afternoon at the Whitehall Church of the Nazarene, 745 South Yearling Road, Whitehall, Ohio. Harman, George W.
 
 
December 8, 1918
 
 
Harman, Henry
Died: June 5, 1915
 
2003X
DEATH
Source: The Marietta Times, dated Saturday, December 27, 2003
Janice Lee Kahrig Harman
COLUMBUS - Janice Lee Kahrig Harman, 69, of Columbus died Wednesday (Dec. 24, 2003).
She was born Sept. 6, 1934, in Lewisville to Edwin C. and Mary M. Truax Kahrig. Her family moved to Marietta while she was a little girl. She graduated from Marietta High School in 1952 and later graduated from Mountain State College in West Virginia.
 
She married Richard E. Harman of Graysville and the couple moved to Columbus, where they raised their three daughters. She was active with the Girl Scouts of America as a leader and was a member of Shady Lane Presbyterian Church, where she served as a lay leader and elder and with the Women's Association.
 
She was employed by the Franklin County MRDD program and retired from there with many years of love and service to the children who attended the school and their parents.
 
She was preceded in death by her husband, Richard Harman, who died in 2001; and her parents.
 
She is survived by three daughters, Cynthia Dawn "Cindy" Harman, Jolanda Lynne "Jody" Morgan, and Elizabeth Lee "Beth" Lucas; seven grandchildren, Erynne, Benjamin, Emilee, Joshua, Jarod, Eli and Andrew; one sister, Sandra Sue Kahrig Winans; a dear friend, Barbara Applegarth; and many aunts, uncles, nieces and nephews.
 
Services are at 2 p.m. Tuesday at Shady Lane Presbyterian Church at 4117 E. Livingston Ave., Columbus, with Irvin Moxley officiating. Burial is in Forest Lawn Cemetery in Columbus. The family will receive friends from 6 to 8 p.m. Monday at Evans Funeral Home at 4171 E. Livingston Ave., Columbus, and from 1 to 2 p.m. Tuesday at the church.

Harmon, Raymond "Gene" Eugene
SOURCE: Daily Jeffersonian . . Cambridge, OH . . 26 Jul 2001
WOODSFIELD Raymond Eugene Gene Harmon, 73, of Rinard Mills (Marr community) died Tuesday (July 24, 2001) at Marietta Memorial Hospital.
He was born Jan. 29, 1928, in Graysville, son of the late Harry and Wilna (Cline) Harmon.
Mr. Harmon was a retired school bus driver for Switzerland of Ohio School District in Monroe County, having served for 25 years.
He was also a former maintenance worker for Wayne National Forest, and was a former Bethel Township trustee for 16 years.
He was a U.S. Army veteran, having served in the Korean War. He was a Protestant by faith.
He was preceded in death by a daughter, Brenda Scarbro; a sister, Shirley Flauhaus; a brother, Leonard Harmon; and a grandson, Edward John Britton.
He leaves his wife, Pauline (McCune) Harmon, whom he married July 9, 1952; four daughters, Mrs. Daiton (Susan) Scarbro and Mrs. Leroy (Glenda) Scarbro, both of Rinard Mills, Mrs. Paul (Betty) Britton of Marietta and Mrs. Brian (Kathy) Graham of Dart; a brother, Larry (Hope) Harmon of Washington, W.Va.; three sisters, Mrs. Norbert (Ada) Schumacher of Woodsfield, Mrs. Dewey (Ann) Queen of Parkersburg, W.Va., and Mrs. Vernon (Patty) Alberry of Newark; a sister-in-law, Ethel Harmon of Marietta; 10 grandchildren; a great-granddaughter; nine step-great-grandchildren; several nieces and nephews.
Friends may call from 2 to 4 and 7 to 9 p.m. Friday at Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services will be 11 a.m. Saturday with Harold B. Kinney Jr. officiating.
Burial will be in Mt. Hope Cemetery, near Marr.

Harper, Effie A. Harper
 
 
April 4, 1924
 
Harper, Floyd
Floyd Harper Dies In Japanese Camp
June 24, 1943
Source: Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
Royden Harper of Canton has been notified by The War Department that his son, Pvt. Floyd Harper died in a Japanese prison in The Philippines on June 11. The telegram was received by Mr. Harper , Saturday, June 19th.
Pvt. Harper was inducted into the Army in Detroit, Michigan in April 1941 and was first sent to Aberdeen Proving Grounds in Maryland. He was later transferred to The Savannah Air Base in Georgia and then sent to Corregidor in The Philippines. The last word the family had from him directly was a telegram on Christmas Day in 1941.
Pvt. Harper was born near Malaga on September 22, 1914, the son of Roydon Harper and the late Nina Stalder Harper. His mother preceded him in on August 26,1928, as did a sister, Lucille in February 1937.
He was a member of The Evangelical and Reformed Church in Louisville, Stark County, having been confirmed at the age of 12 years. He graduated from The Lewisville High School in Monroe County in the class of 1933. He was employed in Detroit several years before being inducted into The Army.
In addition to his father, he is survived by two brothers who are in the armed forces: Cpl. Virgil Harper of Camp Forest, Tennessee and Pfc. Ray Harper who is on maneuvers in Louisiana, and two sisters, Mrs. Frances Heft, the former Miss Vivian Harper, of Lewisville and Miss Phyllis Harper of Canton. Two grandmothers also survive, Mrs. James Harper of near Malaga and Mrs. Louise Stalder of Miltonsburg.

Born: February 10, 1922, died: January 1978, residence:Beallsville, Ohio
 
Harper, Royden R.

1968

Royden R. Harper, age 78, of 146 Towmont Road, S. W., Massillon, passed away Wednesday morning, June 26, 1968, in Massillon. He had been in failing health for the past four years.

He was born November 8, 1889, in Monroe County, the son of the late James and Mary Beadmore Harper.

Mr. Harper had been a resident of the Canton-Massillon area for the past fifty years. He was a retired carpenter and had been employed by Gibbons and Grable Construction Company.

He was a member of the Lowell United Church of Christ and the Seaman Bible Class.

Surviving are his wife, Sarah Egger Harper; three sons, Virgil S. Harper and Ray C. Harper, both of Canton; James J. Harper, of Massillon; two daughters, Mrs. Francis (Vivian) Heft, of Lewisville, and Mrs. William (Phyllis) Roudebush of North Canton; two sisters, Mrs. Amelia Neuhardt, of Lewisville, and Mrs. Stella Carpenter of Fairview; thirteen grandchildren; six great grandchildren.

Funeral services will be held Saturday morning at 10:30 o'clock in the Reed Funeral Home in Canton, with the Rev. L. Meld Becker officiating. Burial will be in Sunset Hill Burial Park in Canton.

Calling hours at the funeral home will be Friday afternoon from two until four o'clock and in the evening from seven until nine o'clock.

Green Twp.
 
Harrigan, Wilda Harrigan, nee Helsley
Wilda M. Harrigan, 66, of Mellott Street, Powhatan Point, Ohio, died Monday, April 5, 2004 at the Allegheny General Hospital, Pittsburgh, Pa. She was born March 31, 1938 at Jacobsburg, Ohio, a daughter of the late John and Vera Hicks Helsley.
Wilda was a homemaker and a member of the Powhatan Nazarene Church.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by a daughter, Shelly Thomas, son Mark Harrigan and a grandson, Shain Baker.
Surviving are her husband, Ronald D. Harrigan, Sr., of Powhatan Point, a daughter, Eldonna Schrader of Great Mills, Maryland; a son, Ronald D. Harrigan, Jr. and his wife, Tyrena of Powhatan Point; three sisters, Martha Underwood of Jacobsburg, Elda Loughman of Claysville, Pa., and Shirley Jeffers of Glencoe, Ohio; a brother, John Helsley of Claysville; six grandchildren and two great grandchildren.
Friends will be received on Friday from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m., at the Bauknecht-Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 186 Main Street, Powhatan Point, Ohio, where services will be held Saturday at 11 a.m., with Pastor Don Lawson officiating. Burial follows in Powhatan Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made to Powhatan Nazarene Church.

Harrison, Billy Eugene "Bill"
Source- News Register Wheeling, West Virginia
Published--April 30, 2003
Billy Eugene Bill Harrison,62, of Reader, West Virginia., died Monday, April 29, 2003, at
the Wetzel County Hospital, New Martinsville, West Virginia. He was a member Church of Christ, Reader, West Virginia. He retired from the Venco Plant, Moundsville, West Virginia. Bill, was also a member of the Shortline Lions Club, the Pine Grove Sportsman Club, a Democrat Committeeman, the former President at Venco Union for the Moundsville Plant and he loved to fish and hunt.
He was preceded in death by his parents, Bride and Zelma Bland Harrison; and a brother, Francis.
Surviving are his wife, Louisa Morris Harrison; three sons, Donnie and his wife, Tina, of Pine Grove,
Roger of Paden City and Kevin and his fiancee, Penny Higgins, of Paden City; a daughter, Regina
Lemley and her husband, Pete, of Reader, West Virginia.; two brothers, David of Smithfield, West Virginia, and
Robert of Reader, West Virginia &; five sisters, Betty Streets and Geraldine Bassett, both of Piney, Linda Tyler
of Sardis, Ohio, Dolly Story of Hannibal, Ohio, and June Salisbury of Pennsylvania; his
mother-in-law, Gladys Morris of Reader, West Virginia.; four grandchildren, Jackie, Donnie, Kayla and Ryan;
several nieces and nephews.
Friends received 2-9 p.m. Wednesday at Palmer Funeral Home, Pine Grove, West Virginia. Services will be held at 11 a.m.
Thursday at the Church of Christ, Pine Grove. Interment in Knights of Pythias Cemetery, Pine Grove.
Wheeling News-Register Wednesday, April 30, 2003

Cameron
 
Hartline, James "Jim"
August 7th, 2004
James E. Jim Hartline, age 62 of Cain Ridge Road, Clarington, Ohio died Saturday, August 7, 2004 at Wetzel County Hospital.
He was born April 16, 1942 in Warren, Ohio the son of the late Earl and Ilah Decker Hartline.
He was a retired electrician/foreman from Republic Steel, Canton, Ohio. He was a member of the Clarington Masonic Lodge #597 F&AM, a 32nd degree Mason, a member and current commander of the American Legion Post #760, Hannibal, a US Navy veteran, and a member of the Church of the Nazarene, Woodsfield. He loved fishing, hunting, and spending time with his family.
Survivors include his wife of 40 years, Jeannette Baughman Hartline; one daughter: Teri (Bob) Nicewander of Canton, Ohio; one son: James (Suzanne) Hartline, Jr. of Louisville, Ohio; his two grandsons, who were the love of his life: James Phillip and Max Domenic Hartline; two brothers: Lawrence Albert Al (Marie) Hartline of New Jersey; Kenneth E. (Roseanne) Hartline of Woodsfield, Ohio; and one sister: Kathy (Jim) Conley of Cameron, Ohio.
At Jim s request, there will be no visitation or services, he will be buried with his parents on Indian Mound, at the convenience of the family. Arrangements entrusted to Grisell Funeral Home, Clarington, Ohio.
Source--Grisell Funeral Home Obituaries on Line

Hartshorn, Harlan

Hartshorn, Hiram Eugene
Source--Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday March 23, 2000
Hartshorn, H. Eugene ,77, of 34143 Harshorn Ridge Road, Graysville, died March 19, 2000, at home. He was born September 16, 1922, near Graysville, a son of the late Ray and Anna Smith Hartshorn.
He was a retired employee of the former Consolidated Aluminum Corporation, Hannibal, a member of the United Steelworkers of America, Local 5760 District 1, Clarington, a member of Stafford Lodge Number 300 Free and Accepted Masons,Stafford, a member of Ancient Accepted Scottish Rite, Valley of Cambridge, a member of the Alladin Shrine Temple, Columbus, served several years as a formal Wayne Township Trustee in Monroe County, a former member of the Monroe Water Board, a former Democratic Committeeman for Wayne Township and a member of the A.S.C. Committee for Monroe County.
Surviving are his wife, Eva Jean Highman Hartshorn, whom he married on November 16, 1945; four sons, Phillip Hartshorn and his wife, Iris (Young) Lewisville, Robert Hartshorn and his wife, Peggy (Knowlton), Graysville, Scott Hartshorn and his wife, Lisa (Ellis), Graysville, Douglas Hartshorn and his wife , Lisa, (Finney), Columbus; three daughters, Mrs. John ( Martha Louise) Reed, Woodsfield, Mrs. David (Janice) McClister, Summerville, South Carolina, Mrs.Murray (Madelyn) Winland, Johnstown; a brother, Heber Hartshorn, Woodsfield; four sisters, Gertrude Hines, Ruth Mallett, both of Lewisville, Anna June Bishop, Santa Clara, California, Rosalie Dougherty, Louisville; 11 grandchildren, Kevin Hartshorn, Lakewood, Mrs. Tom (Elaine) Wise, Lewis Center, Amanda Hartshorn, Columbus, Mrs. David (Bobbi Jo) Rochus, Johnstown, Jennifer Hartshorn, Graysville, Mrs. Matthew (Olivia) Corsello, Oswego, New York, David McClister, Jr., Rebecca McClister, both of Summerville, Hannah Hartshorn, Maggie Hartshorn, both of Graysville, Grace Christine Hartshorn, Columbus; four great-grandchildren, Sarah Hartshorn, Lakewood, Andrew Wise, Jared Wise , both of Lewis Center, Gillian Corsello, Oswego, several nieces and nephews
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a son, Reginald Duane Hartshorn; three brothers, Demoin Hartshorn, Samuel Hartshorn, Linsey Dean Hartshorn; two sisters, Geneva Highman, Alice Merideth Hartshorn
Friends were received at the Watters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, March 21, where funeral services will be held at 11 a.m. March 22, with Harold Kinney, Jr. officiating. Burial will follow in the Hartshorn Ridge Cemetery, near Graysville. Masonic services were held March 21 at the funeral home.
Memorial contributions may be made to the Hartshorn Ridge Cemetery Association, in care of Gary Hogue, 43670
Ullman-Hines Road, Lewisville, Ohio 43754
 
Hartshorn, James I.
October 2, 1920
 
 
April 20, 1989

ENGAGEMENT

Hartshorn, Julie Donnell and Winland, Matthew Arian

Mr. and Mrs. Donald E. Hartshorn of Woodsfield are pleased to announce the engagement of their youngest daughter, Julie Donnell, to Matthew Arian Winland, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Francis Winland of Lewisville.

The bride elect is a 1985 graduate of Woodsfield High School. She is currently employed by Riesbeck's Food Market in Woodsfield.

Her fiance is a 1988 graduate of Skyvue High School and also of Swiss Hills Vocational School. He is currently employed by Funk Finecasting Company in Columbus. A June 17 wedding is planned.

Lewisville
 
 
Hartshorn, Norman Clayton 'Bub'
Source:The Marietta Times, Monday, March 15, 2004
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
NEW MATAMORAS - Norman Clayton "Bub" Hartshorn, 80, of Ohio 7, New Matamoras, died at 12:30 p.m. Saturday (March 13, 2004) at his residence.
He was born November 25, 1923, in Newport to Clarence and Elizabeth Hanes Hartshorn. He graduated from Newport High School with the Class of 1942. He worked as a member of Pipefitters Local 83 at Wheeling, W.Va., and was a construction supervisor for Bayer (Mobay) Chemical Co. from which he retired in 1983. He was a U.S. Navy veteran who served in the South Pacific during World War II and was a lifeLong member of Matamoras Church of Christ.
On August 13, 1948, he married Betty J. Hutchison, who survives with two children, Douglas Hartshorn and his wife, Judie, of Newport and Theresa Gautschi and her husband, Dan, of New Matamoras; two grandsons, Danny Gautschi and his wife, Lynn, of Pittsburgh and Mark Hartshorn of Newport; three great-grandchildren, Ian, Mason and Regan Elizabeth of Pittsburgh; three brothers, Lloyd Hartshorn of Reno, James Hartshorn of Columbia, S.C., and Jack Hartshorn of Parkersburg; and one sister, Bernice Hitchens of Youngstown.
He was preceded in death by his parents; three sisters, Lucille Hartshorn, Mildred Stancliff and Hazel Flick; and six brothers, Harold, George, Russell, Donald, Floyd and Richard.
Services are at 1 p.m. Tuesday at Ingram Funeral Home in St. Marys, W.Va., with Todd Bradford officiating. Burial is in Newport Cemetery in Newport. Calling hours are from 2 to 4 and 6 to 8 p.m. today at the funeral home.
 
 
Hartshorn, Samuel Hartshorn

Hartshorn, Sarah Elizabeth, nee Gardner
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, dated, April 25, 1928
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
Sarah Elizabeth Gardner was born near Creighton Ridge, Monroe County, Ohio, November 2, 1873, and departed this life in Woodsfield, Ohio, April 20, 1928, at the age of 54 years 5 months and 18 days.
She was united in marriage to Eugene B. Hartshorn, July 16, 1899. To this union five children were born. Three of these, namely, Harry R., Edmond C., and Carrie L. preceded the mother to The Spirit World. Mr. Hartshorn died August 21, 1905.
Three years ago she made a profession to her Savior; and was baptized into The Church of Christ. Of near relatives, she leaves one sister, Mrs. Oscar Ogle; two brothers, James and Samuel Gardner; one son, Earl; two daughters, Mrs. Earl Fisher and Miss Wilma; also three grandchildren
Funeral services in charge of H. H. Adamson were held at Hartshorn Church, Monday at 10:00 a.m., April 23. The body was laid beside that of her husband in the adjoining cemetery.

Hartshorn, Waveline
Source--Reed Memorial Obituaries Canton, Ohio
Published--(No Date)
Waveline Hartshorn , age 80 of Canton, a devout Christian went home to be with the Lord passing away Sunday morning following a brief illness at Aultman Hospital. Born in Lewisville, Ohio on November 3, 1921 to the late Charles N. and Nellie (Orange) Cree. She was a 30 year retired assembler from the Hoover Company and was an active member of the Order of the Eastern Star Canton Chapter #109.
Besides her parents, she is preceded in death by her loving husband Samuel L Hartshorn and a son Richard Hartshorn.
Survivors include her daughter and son-in-law, Faye and David McKenna of Canton. Five grandchildren and their spouses, Sharon and Don Harper of Strongsville, Ohio; David and Amy McKenna of Canton; Mark and Richard McKenna of Canton and Wava Ann Hartshorn of Akron, Ohio. There are six great-grandchildren. Two sisters, Eva Zerger and Ethel Heft both of Woodsfield, Ohio; one brother, Dale R. Cree of Jerusalem, Ohio.
Funeral services will he conducted Thursday at 11 a.m. in the Greenwood Christian Church with Minister, Tony Amerine officiating. Burial will be in Sunset Hills Burial Park. Calling hours at the Reed Funeral Home on Wednesday evening from 7-9 p.m. Memorial donations may be made in her name to the Greenwood Christian Church, 4425 Frazer Avenue , North West., Canton, Ohio 44709 and to the American Cancer Society, 925 South Main Street, North Canton, Ohio 44720.

Graysville
 
Hartshorn, William Ray
Source--News Clipping
Published--May 1984
Hartshorn, William Ray, 98, of Route 1, Graysville, died May 2 at his home. He was born July 27, 1886 in Monroe County, the son of Samuel and Nancy Dillon Hartshorn.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Anna Frances Smith Hartshorn in May 1979; also one son, Linsey Hartshorn and a daughter Meredith Hartshorn.
He was a retired oil field worker and farmer; a member of the Hartshorn Ridge Church of Christ..
Surviving are five daughters, Mrs. Geneva Highman of Woodsfield, Mrs. Gertrude Hines and Mrs. Ruth Mallett, both of Route 2, Lewisville, Mrs. Anna June Bishop of Santa Clara, California, Mrs. Roslea Dougherty of Louisville, Stark County; four sons, Demoin Hartshorn and Eugene Hartshorn, both of Route 1, Graysville, Sam Hartshorn of North Canton, and Heber Hartshorn of Woodsfield; 23 grandchildren; 46 great-grandchildren; 14 great-great grandchildren.
Friends were received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held Saturday. Burial in Hartshorn Ridge Cemetery, Route 1, Graysville with Minister Tim Fleeman officiating.
, William Ray
Source--News Clipping
Published--May 1984
Hartshorn, William Ray, 98, of Route 1, Graysville, died May 2 at his home. He was born July 27, 1886 in Monroe County, the son of Samuel and Nancy Dillon Hartshorn.
He was preceded in death by his wife, Anna Frances Smith Hartshorn in May 1979; also one son, Linsey Hartshorn and a daughter Meredith Hartshorn.
He was a retired oil field worker and farmer; a member of the Hartshorn Ridge Church of Christ..
Surviving are five daughters, Mrs. Geneva Highman of Woodsfield, Mrs. Gertrude Hines and Mrs. Ruth Mallett, both of Route 2, Lewisville, Mrs. Anna June Bishop of Santa Clara, California, Mrs. Roslea Dougherty of Louisville, Stark County; four sons, Demoin Hartshorn and Eugene Hartshorn, both of Route 1, Graysville, Sam Hartshorn of North Canton, and Heber Hartshorn of Woodsfield; 23 grandchildren; 46 great-grandchildren; 14 great-great grandchildren.
Friends were received at the Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held Saturday. Burial in Hartshorn Ridge Cemetery, Route 1, Graysville with Minister Tim Fleeman officiating.
 
Harvey, Margaret Smith, nee Harvey
Margaret Harvey Smith, Word has been received of the death of Margaret H. Smith, 97, of Lubbock, Texas, who died Saturday, Jan. 19, 1991.
She was born April 11, 1893, a daughter of Charles T. and Teressa Hawkins Harvey, who lived in Rutan.
Her husband, Russell F. Smith, whom she married in 1916, died Jan. 16, 1988.
Mrs. Smith was a housewife and a member of Ojai Valley Methodist Church in Ojai, California, where she resided for a number of years.
She is survived by a daughter, Betty L. Hardin of Lubbock; a sister, Helen H. Crow of Graysville; five grandchildren; three great-grandchildren; and a number of nieces and nephews.
Deceased are a son, Charles B. Smith; two brothers, Samuel H. Harvey and James Frederick Harvey; and two sisters, Bernice Orndoff and Beatrice Throckmorton.
Private services were held Friday, Jan. 25. Mrs. Smith will be interred with her husband in Rosemont Cemetery, Rogersville.
The family suggests memorial contributions to the Methodist Hospital Foundation or the Oakwood Baptist Building Fund, both of Lubbock.

Hastings, Bertha S., nee Shugert
SOURCE: The Times-Leader, Jan 23, 1962
Mrs. Bertha Shugert Hastings, 76, of Woodsfield, died Monday morning at her home following a lengthy illness. She was born March 3, 1885, at Freeport, a daughter of Frank and Alfretta Thompson Shugert. Her husband, Frank Hastings, died on Sept. 4, 1950.
Surviving are a daughter, Mrs. Margaret Owens, of near Freeport; a son, E. C. Hastings of Woodsfield; a sister, Mrs. Ethel Saddler of Cleveland; two brothers, Ralph Shugert of Freeport, and Roy Shugert of Old Washington, eight grandchildren, and seven great-grandchildren.
Friends may call at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home Woodsfield where services will be held at 12:30 p.m. Wednesday. An additional services will be held at Freeport Cemetery at 3 p.m. with Rev. John Benson officiating.

Haudenschield, Graydon C.
 
April 2, 1909
 
April 4, 1994
Woodsfield
 
 
Samuel H. Haudenschield
Published--The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio
June 27, 1918
Although knowledge that S.H. Haudenschield of Antioch was in very poor health was generally known by his many friends in Woodsfield and throughout Monroe County the news of his , which occured Thursday morning at Magnetic Springs, Ohio came as a great shock because of his universal popularity with all classes of people. Kind, obliging,
courteous to all and ever ready to lend a helping hand to the misfortunate and distressed, upright and honorable in his Dealings, he numbered as his friends and those who knew him and his leaves a sense of personal loss to all.
Some months ago he was stricken with his fatal illness, diabetis and grew gradually worse, although at times he rallied, giving hope to his friends of complete recovery.
About three weeks ago he went to Magnetic Springs, Ohio where it was hoped the treatment would be beneficial but which proved unavailing. On Wednesday morning, County Treasurer, M.C. Dougherty received a telegram to be forWarded to the family saying that the end was probably near. His son, Erret, came to Woodsfield , Wednesday evening and left Thursday morning for his bedside but the father had passed away before his arrival.
The remains were brought to Woodsfield, Friday evening and taken to the home from which on Sunday afternoon they were taken to to the M.E.Church, of which he was a member, where funeral services were conducted by Rev. Knipping, pastor of The Woodsfield Evangelical Church. The crowd in attendance, the largest ever seen in the village, was an evidence of the esteem in which the deceased was held, friends being drawn from all directions and great distances to pay their final tribute. Interment in the village cemetery. Deceased was about 57 years of age.
Of the immediate family he leaves to mourn his , the widow and six children, one son, C.E and five daughters; Mrs J.R. Hill and Mrs. Ed Yester of Breman, Ohio ; Mrs Will Yester of Trail Run and Mrs. Ross Hamilton and Miss Hazel of the home.
(typed by betty
 
Haueisen, MIss Joyce Lee and Stephen J. Heft

August 10, 1972

WEDDING

Haueisen-Heft

Source: Monroe County Beacon

Miss Joyce Lee Hausisen, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert B. Haueisen of Columbus, Ohio, and Stephen J. Heft, of Woodsfield, Ohio, were united in marriage at half after one o'clock Saturday afternoon, July first, in an open church, double ring ceremony at St. Mark Lutheran Church, Columbus, Ohio with Pastor Joe Will officiating.

Given in marriage by her father, the bride wore a gown of white organza fashioned with empire waist and Chantilly lace V neckline, bishop sleeves and detachable train. She carried a bouquet of white carnations, pink Rosebuds, stephanotis and ivy.

Matron of honor was Mrs. Linda Watkins and bridesmaids were Mrs. Diane WoodWard and Miss Ruby Skedell, all of Columbus. Flower girl was Miss Julie Fodor, friend of the bride.

Best man was Mr. Merle Reich, cousin of the bridegroom. Ushering were Mr. Randy Rodich and Mr. Ronald Haueisen, of Columbus; Mr. Charles Harpster, of Tucson Arizona, and Mr. Mark Decker, of Woodsfield. Ring bearer was Master Richard E. Schumacher, Jr., nephew of the bridegroom.

A reception followed at the church.

Mrs. Heft was graduated from Whetstone High School and is a secretary at the Ohio State University Development Fund. Her husband is a graduate of Capital University, Columbus and is a teacher in the Columbus Public School System.

The couple is residing at 531 Pinetree West, Apt. A, Columbus, Ohio 43229.

Hawks, Edsell T.
 
September 7, 1904

Lewisville
 
Haws, Norma J.(Stegner)
Source:Canton Repository . . . Canton, OH . . . 11 Apr 2003
Provided by Betty Lendon Matson
Norma J. Haws, age 74, of Canton, died Thursday morning (10 Apr 2003) in her home following a brief illness. Born in Woodsfield, OH, to the late George and Garnet (Ewing) Stegner. She was a Canton area resident for the past 30 years. Member of the North Industry United Methodist Church, Order of Eastern Star, Ellsworth Chapter #247 and the Canton South Womens Club. Norma served as an active volunteer with the Childrens Hospital Medical Center at Akron where she made over 20,000 Pinky Puppets. She is also preceded in death by her husband, Harry Bob Haws in 1995. Survived by two daughters, Diana Haws of Canton, Faye Haws of Cuyahoga Falls; one son and daughter-in-law, Michael and
Barbara Haws of Canton; three grandchildren, Scott Haws, Laila Haws, Jason Haws and his fiance, Erin; one great-grandchild, Adrian Haws; one sister, Ruth Baker of Columbus, OH; sister-in-law and her husband, Marg and John Grabau of Minnesota; brother-in-law and his wife, Don and Del Haws of Georgia. Services will be Monday at 10 a.m. in the Kreighbaum-Sanders Funeral Home on S. Cleveland Ave. with Rev. David Ross officiating. Interment in Melscheimer Cemetery. Friends may call Sunday 2-5 p.m. In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to the North Industry United Methodist Church at PO Box 40, Canton, OH 44707.
 
Hawks, Hazel Mae, nee Jarvis
Source--Daily Jeffersonian Cambridge, Ohio
Published---November 27, 2001
Hawks, Hazel Mae, 94, of Woodsfield, died Sunday (November 25, 2001) at The Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. She was born May 20, 1907, in Chicago, Ill., daughter of the late Chester and Irene (Erickson) Jarvis.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Jesse W. Hawks, who died March 5, 1976.
Mrs. Hawkes was a member of The Church of Later Day Saints.
She leaves a daughter, Mrs. William (Willa) Carter of Woodsfield; three grandchildren,
Linda Zern of Holly Springs, N.C., William Carter ll of Germany and Ilaina Carter of Woodsfield; and six great-grandchildren.
No calling hours or services will be observed. Burial will be at the convience of the family. Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, is handling arrangements.
 
Hayes, Allen
 
May 3, 1910
 
June 1984
 
Woodsfield
 
Hayes, Amelia M.
 
December 15, 1913
 
March 12, 1996
Woodsfield
 
Hayes, Anna
 
August 13, 1898
 
February 1989
 
Sardis
 
Hayes, Charles A. Hayes
 
 
October 9, 1929
 
Hayes, Darla Jo and Donald Kahrig

Salesville - A candlelight ceremony on December 3, 1982, at Salesville Church of Faith united in marriage Miss Darla Jo Hayes and Donald Lee Kahrig.

The bride is the daughter of Dean Hayes, Freeport R.D. 1, and the late Shirley Hayes. Parents of the bridegroom are Ben Kahrig and Nellie Kahrig of Salesville.

The Reverend Allen Van Fossen officiated at the double ring 6:30 p.m. ceremony. At this time, the couple lighted a unity candle at the altar, decorated with basket arrangements of gladiolas, chrysanthemums and red carnations. A single white Rose was placed on the altar by the bride in memory of her mother.

The bride, given in marriage by her father, wore a gown of chiffon over taffeta, trimmed with lace. It was designed with Queen Anne neckline, chiffon cummerbund at the waist of the empire bodice, and accented with Venise lace, seed pearls and sequins. The softly flowering skirt, with hemline trim of Venise daisies, extended to a chapel train.

The bride's Venise lace head piece held her veil and blusher, also trimmed with Venise daisies and pearls. Her flowers were miniature white carnations, red Rose buds and baby's breath.

Traditional wedding music was presented by Kathy Carpenter, vocalist, and Doris Carpenter, pianist.

Dianne Simmons was maid of honor in a burgundy gown with matching accessories. Her flowers were miniature white carnation and a single red Rose. January Kahrig, brother of the bridegroom, was best man.

A reception for the family followed at Sts. Peter and Paul Center, Lore City, where decorations were red and white. Hostesses were Lisa Fenstamaker, step sister of the bride, and Lori Conrad.

The bride is a graduate of Buckeye Trail High School and employed with Dr. Charles Evans, Cadiz.

Her husband graduated from Quaker City High School and is employed with Beckowitz. Truckiing Company, Morristown.

Following a brief wedding trip to Niagara Falls, the couple is residing at 65685 Lydick Road, Quaker City.

Hayes, George L residence: Jerusalem enlistment: 1918 Jun 23 b.p.:Atlas, Ohio Born: 1889 Sep 8

Hayes, John D.

August 2, 1995
 
Sardis
 
 
HAYES, Mrs. Mary HAYES (nee Carpenter)
Mrs. Mary Carpenter HAYES, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Vincent CARPENTER, was born January 13, 1844, and died February 23, 1916, aged 73 years, one month and 10 days. She was united in marriage to Leonard HAYES about the year 1865. To this union were born eight children, three sons and five daughters. The two daughters have preceded her in . She was buried at Calais, Ohio, being at the time of her a member of the Methodist Episcopal Church at that place.
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, Woodsfield, Ohio, Thursday, March 2, 1916
Collection of Gertrude Christman Kahrig

Source:The Spirit of Democracy, dated, November 20, 1929
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
Ross Hayes, of Portsmouth, Ohio, son of the late Asa Hayes ofBeallsville, Ohio, died Sunday afternoon at home in that city. Death was due to asthma and complications involving the heart. He had been a resident of Portsmouth the past fifteen years and was formerly in business at Barnesville.
He is survived by his wife, three sons and two daughters.
Funeral services will be held this Wednesday at Barnesville under auspices of The Masonic Lodge.

Headley, Jerry Dean
Source--Wetzel County Message Board West Virginia
Published--January 1997
Jerry Dean Hedley, 57, of Hannibal, died Friday, January 24, 1997, in Camden Clark Memorial Hospital, Parkersburg, West Virginia. He was employed by Ormet Corporation, Hannibal, Ohio and attended the First Baptist Church, Paden City. He was preceded in death by his parents,Benjamin Morgan and Joy Elizabeth Postlethwait Headley; two brothers. Surviving are his wife, Sandra Langford Cornell Headley; a son, Jason of Hannibal, Ohio; a stepdaughter, Tanya Cornell of Saint Marys; a stepson, Patrick Cornell of Saint Marys; two brothers, Wayne of Paden City, and Robert Worth of Wilsonburg, West Virginia; two sisters, Virginia Tracy of Reader and Melba Mason of Paden City; several nieces and nephews. Friends were received at Ruttencutter Funeral Home, Saint Marys. West Virginia. Interment in Paden Memorial Gardens, Paden City.

Heath, Samuel Heath
 
 
November 2, 1916
 
Heatherington,Joseph Published--September 4, 2004
Joseph R. Heatherington, 69, of Martins Ferry, died Saturday, Sept. 4, 2004, at the Wheeling Hopsital in Wheeling, W.Va. He was born Sept. 17, 1934, in Bellaire, a son of the late Joseph R. and Catherine Gasser Heatherington. Joe was retired from the shipping department of the Wheeling-Pittsburgh Steel Corporation's Martins Ferry mill and a member of the St. John Catholic Church in Bellaire, the VFW Post 626 in Bellaire, and American Legion Post 38 of Martins Ferry. He was a U.S. Army Veteran.In addition to his parents, Joe was preceded in death by his brother, Melvin Heatherington. Surviving are his wife, Jo Ann A. Otto Heatherington; one son, Joseph P. Heatherington of Martins Ferry; and two brothers, Arden Heatherington of Moundsville, W.Va., and George Heatherington of Pittsburgh, Pa. Family and friends will be received at the Bauknecht- Altmeyer Funeral Homes and Crematory, 441 37th Street, Bellaire, on Monday from 4 to 8 p.m., where services will be held on Monday at 11 a.m. with Monsignor Gene W. Mullett officiating. Interment will be in the Powhatan Cemtery in Powhatan Point, Ohio, with full military honors conducted by the Belmont County Council of the American Legion. Memorial contributions may be made to the American Heart Association Ohio Valley Affiliate, P.O. Box 182039, Dept. 013, Columbus, Ohio 43218- 2039. Online condolences may be offered to Joe's family at www.altmeyer.com.

Heft, Elizabeth Heft
 
 
December 5, 1935
 
Heft, floyd and Rolland
Sgt. Rolland J. Heft & Lt. Floyd E. Heft
Published---1944
Rolland and Floyd are the sons of Mr. and Mrs. John Heft of Lewisville, Route 1.
Rolland was inducted into the Army in November of 1942 and received the majority of his training at Fort Custer, Michigan. He has been serving in the Middle East for the past year, and is now stationed somewhere in Asia. He has paid two visits to the Holy Land. He was promoted to the rank of Sergeant sometime in January. Before entering the Armed forces he was co-operator of his father's farms, and has not received a furlough since his induction. Rolland also received the Good Conduct Medal since being stationed overseas. Anyone wishing his address can have it by contacting this office or one of his family.
Floyd enlisted in the Cadets in June of 1942 and received his call to duty the following February, with a deficiency of two months of furthur study at Ohio State University to receive his B. Sc. and a Degree in Agriculture. He completed his Cadet Training at Stuttgart Army Air Field, where he received the rating of a pilot and received the Commission of a Second Lietenant. Immediately following his graduation in March he spent a 10-day leave with his parents. He is now a Flying Instructor in the Twin Engine Bomber advanced training school. His address is: Lt. Floyd E. Heft, Box 454, S.A.A.F.,
Stuttgart, Arkansas.
from the collection of gertrude Christman Kahrig, ty[ed by betty lendon matson
 
Heft, Floyd
Floyd Heft Receives Award
Published---1953
The top aWard of The Ohio Chapter of The Soil Conservation Society of America was aWarded Floyd Heft for his "professionally excellency." The aWard was made at the annual banquet in Columbus this week.
The top aWard was given in recognition of Heft's outstanding achievement in the development of local leadership among district supervisors of Ohio's eighty-seven soil conservation districts.
For the past eight years Heft has served as Executive Secretary of The Ohio Soil Conservation Committee and Extension Specialist in Soil and Water Conservation, Ohio State University.
The Heft's reside at 424 Fallis Road, Columbus, Ohio.
Mr. Heft, after graduating from Ohio State University and serving three and one half years as an Air Force pilot, began his professional work with The Soil Conservation Service of The U.S.D.A. He advanced rapidly as a technician and administrator within The Soil Conservation prior to accepting his present position.
Mr. Heft is the son of Mr. and Mrs. John Heft, lifetime residents of the Lewisville community.
Monroe County beacon
 
Heft, Francis J.
Appointment
Source--Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio
Published-- 1954
Francis J. Heft, Representative to The General Assembly from Monroe County has been appointed as a member of The Citizen's
Narcotics Advisory Committee of the County. At present the advisory group is being organized by The Attorney General.
 
Heft, Francis J.
Breaking Ground For $172,000 Lake Monroe
Published--Monday, June 11, 1956
Shown breaking ground for the new 60 acre Lake Monroe are: Joe J. Reight, Monroe County Game Protector; Francis J. Heft, Monroe County Representative to The General
Assembly, and Everett Ridge District Supervisor of The Ohio Division of Wildlife, Department of Natural Resources. The lake will be located four miles north of Woodsfield. The Department of Wildlife has purchased 800 acres surrounding the lake, which will be used as a public hunting area. In a talk at the ceremony, Mr. Ridge stated that the department expected to buy more land in the future to extend the hunting area. He also said the lake would prove excellent for fishing within two or three years. James Deihl, president of the Woodsfield Chamber of Commerce, introduced the speakers. Francis Heft, gave the principal address of the morning. He thanked all the organizations and individuals who helped make the lake a reality and explained the many details that had to be ironed out before the green light could be turned on for the construction of a lake in Monroe County.
Monroe County Beacon, provided by Lena Kahrig pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson

Heft, John
Born: 2 Dec 1882, died: November 1973, residence: Lewisville
Heft, John
Source--News Clipping
Published--(No Dates)
WOODSFIELD--John Heft, 90, of Lewisville, Route 1, a retired farmer, died Tuesday morning in Summit Acres Nursing Home in Caldwell.
He was born, December 2, 1882 in Lewisville, a son of Louis and Elizabeth Schaeffer Heft.
He was a member of Trinity United Methodist Church of Christ in Lewisville and the Grange.
Surviving are three daughters, Miss Beulah Heft of Columbus, Mrs. Mildred Hulme of San Antonio, Texas and Mrs. Wilda Bartenschlag of Lewisville; three sons, Rolland and Urban, both of Lewisville, Route 1, and Floyd of Columbus; 16 grandchildren and 5 great-grandchildren; and a sister, Mrs. Catherine Widmer of San Antonio, Texas.
His wife, the former Leona Mary Hoffmeister, died October 23, 1969.
Friends may call after 7 p.m. today at Bauer and Turner Funeral Home here , where services will be held at 2 p.m. Sunday with Reverend Marshall Cook officiating. Burial will be in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville, Ohio.
 

Heft, Leona Mary (nee Hoffmeister)

Mrs. Leona Mary Heft, age 80, of Lewisville, Route 1, died Thursday morning, October 23, 1969, at 11:50 o'clock, in Marietta Memorial Hospital following an illness.

Born July 13, 1889, in Wheeling, V. Va., she was a daughter of Herman and Louisa Hoff Hoffmeister.

Mrs. Heft was a member of Trinity United Church of Christ and the Women's Guild of the church.

Surviving are her husband, John Heft; three daughters, Miss Beulah Heft, of Columbus; Mrs. Mildred Hulme, of San Antonio, Texas, and Mrs. Wilda Bartenschlag, of Lewisville, Route; three sons, Rolland and Urban Heft, of Lewisville, Route1, and Floyd Heft, of Columbus; a twin sister, Mrs. B. A. Yockey of Newark; a step-sister, Mrs. Nellie Weber of New Philadelphia; sixteen grandchildren and one great grandchild.

Funeral services were held Sunday afternoon at two o'clock in the Bauer and Turner Funeral Chapel with Rev. Wilmer Grunwald officiating. Burial was in Friendship Cemetery, Lewisville.

Heft, Lewis, Jr.
Source: The Monroe County Beacon, July 1963
Lewis Heft, 85 of Lewisville died at noon Saturday in Ohio Valley Hospital in Wheeling where he had been a patient the past two weeks.
Mr. Heft was born June 16, 1878, in New Jersey a son of the late Lewis Sr. and Elizabeth Schaefer Heft. He was a member of St. Peter's United Church of Christ of Lewisville.
He was a retired carpenter and farmer.
Surviving are his widow, Minnie Christman Heft of the home; five sons, Francis Heft of Lewisville, William of Newton Falls, Stanley of Woodsfield, Paul of Mantua, and Charles of Aurora; two daughters, Mrs. Bessie Southerland of Woodsfield, and Mrs. Melba Reich of near Jerusalem; 10 grandchildren and five great-grandchildren; a brother John Heft of Lewisville; three sisters, Mrs. Catherine Widmer of Martinsville, N.J., Mrs. Anna Brandeau of Warwood, W. Va. , Mrs. Christina Schaller of Cleveland.
Friends may call at Bauer-Turner Funeral home here where services will be held at 2 p.m. Tuesday with Rev. Donald Stump officiating. Burial will be in Friendship Cemetery at Lewisville.
Heft, Lucille A. Harper
Died: February 22, 1937, residence: Lewisville
 
Marriage
Heft, Marjorie and Neil Frankl
Source--Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday, October 9, 1980
Mr. and Mrs. Francis J. Heft of Lewisville announce the marriage of their daughter, Marjorie, to Neil Frankl, son of Mr. and Mrs. Mark Frankl of Westbury, New York. The wedding was an event of August 19 at the Plaza Hotel in New York City. The Reverend Roderick Dale officiated at the double ring ceremony.
The couple was attended by their friends, Mr. and Mrs. Paul Bates, of Whipple.
Also in attendance were Mrs. Francis Heft, Mrs. William (Ruth) Bartilson, a sister of the bride, of Akron, Mr. and Mrs. Mark Frankl, Mrs. Fred Machino of Dayton and Ms. Kathy Biehl of Athens.
After a honeymoon in New York City, the couple is residing at Lake Washington, Washington, West Virginia. Both Mr. and Mrs. Frankl are attending Parkersburg Community College.
 
Heft, Melba

March 6, 1986

Mabel Heft, nee Riley

Mabel Eileen Riley Heft, 63, of Aurora died Cot. 5, at her home.

She was born in Beallsville and reared by John and Gail Pittman. She attended Beallsville Schools, and worked for several years at Hudson s General Store before marrying Charles Heft of Lewisville.

Mrs. Heft had resided in Aurora for the past 33 years and was a member of James A. Garfield Chapter 508 Order of the Eastern Star. She was retired from the Aurora City Schools where she was a cafeteria supervisor.

Surviving are her daughter, Karen Harris of Aurora, her son-in-law, Patrick; one grandson, Jonathan; one sister, Wanda Aberegg of Beallsville; one niece, Debbie Aberegg and one nephew, Mike Aberegg.

Services were held Oct. 7, in Aurora.

 

 
Heft, Minnie

Heft, Rolland

January 5, 1989

SLEIGH RIDE

Source: Monroe County Beacon

Santa Claus made a surprise visit to Mrs. Janice Emrick's kindergarten class at Skyvue High School December 20. Santa was delivered to the school by Rolland Heft of Lewisville in his one horse sleigh. Heft was assisted by two of Santa's elves: Jeff and Troy Christman, also of Lewisville.

 

 
Heft, Theodore
Source:The Spirit of Democracy, dated, September 2, 1931
Provided by Lena Kahrig Pettit, typed by Betty Lendon Matson
The entire community was saddened to learn of the sudden death of Theodore Heft, 25, of Wheeling formerly of Lewisville, Monroe County.
His death occurred Friday, following a period of ill health. The remains were brought to the home of his parents, Mr. and Mrs. Lewis Heft, Jr., Lewisville, Saturday.
He is survived by his parents, two sisters and four brothers, many other relatives and friends who are saddened by his passing.
Deceased was a young man of many fine qualities and had made for himself a legion of friends. He was a member of The Lewisville Evangelical Church and was liked by everyone.
Funeral services were held from the home of his parents, Monday morning at 10:30 o'clock in charge of his pastor, Rev. Edward Brueseke. Burial was made in the Friendship Cemetery.
 
 
Hehr, Hazel J. Hehr
 
June 26, 1910
 
January 26, 1994
 
Woodsfield
 
 
Hehr, Laura,

Card of Thanks

I wish to extend my sincere thanks to my friends, neighbors and relatives for the lovely Christmas cards, letters and gifts sent me at Christmas time and since I have be ill. Also, thanks to the Women s Guild for their useful gift, the Willing Workers Class for the potted plant, those who visited me, and for the prayers offered by Rev. George Varns and many others. This all helps to make by shut-in days easier. Your kindness will always be remembered.

Mrs. Laura Hehr, Lewisville

Heiskell , Martha
Source--Grisell Memorial Obituaries
Published--January 31, 2005
Heiskell, Martha Heide, of Roanoke, Virginia died Friday, January 28, 2005.
She was born in Wheeling, West Virginia, the daughter of George and Edna Blattler Heide.
She was preceded in death by her husband, Theodore W. Heiskell.
She was a resident of New Martinsville, West Virginia, for many years prior to moving to Roanoke. A graduate of Muskingum College, New Concord, Ohio, she was a former teacher. She was a member of Windsor Hills United Methodist Church in Roanoke.
She is survived by one son and daughter-in-law, Theodore W. and Katherine Heiskell of Delaware, Ohio, a daughter and son-in-law, M. Ellen and Robert J. Robinson of Richmond, Virginia, five grandchildren, M. Diane Rex, M. Jeanette Edwards, Daniel B. Heiskell, Matthew R. Robinson and M. Elizabeth Schmidt, six great-grandchildren, a sister-in-law, Mrs. John R. Heiskell and a large extended family.
The family will receive friends Friday at Grisell Funeral Home in Clarington, Ohio from 1-3 p.m. A graveside service and interment will be held at 3:30 p.m. at Clarington Cemetery.
In lieu of flowers, memorials may be made to Windsor Hills United Methodist Church, 3591 Windsor Road, Roanoke, Virginia 24018 or Good Samaritan Hospice, 3825 Electric Road, South West Suite A., Roanoke, Virginia 24018.

Hendershot, George
Born: April 28, 1896, Died: February 1971, residence: Graysville
 
Hendershot, Gladys G. Winland

Gladys G. Winland, nee Hendershot

Woodsfield-Services were held 1:30 pm. Monday at Waters Funeral Home, Woodsfield, for Gladys Gertrude Winland, 82, Rinard Mills R.D. 1. The Rev. James Gallagher officiated. Burial was in Creighton Ridge Cemetery.

Mrs. Winland died 7:25 a.m. Saturday (Feb. 14, 1987) at Marietta Memorial Hospital following an extended illness.

She was born Aug. 21, 1904, near Marr, the daughter of the late Samuel D. and Laura Martin Hendershot.

Prior to her retirement in 1968, Mrs. Winland had more than 30 years teaching experience in elementary schools in Monroe, Noble and Washington counties.

She was a graduate of Muskingum College.

Mrs. Winland was a member of the Creighton Ridge Church of Christ, Monroe County Retired Teachers Association, Washington County Retired Teachers Association and a former 4-H adviser in Bethel Township.

She leaves her husband, Warren M. Winland, whom she married June 26, 1935; a son, Martin L. of Lower Salem; a sister, Bernice Hendershot of Rinard Mills; a brother, Clyde M. Hendershot of Rinard Mills; a grandson and two great-grandchildren. Source: Monroe County beacon, February 19, 1987

Hendershot, Mary
Source--Times Leader Martins Ferry, Ohio
Published--October 23, 2004
Mary Edith Hendershot, 94, died Friday, October 22, 2004, in the Monroe County Care Center, Woodsfield. She was born January 18, 1910, in Monroe County, a daughter of the late Isaac and Lottie Schnegg Hendershot.She was a member of the Church of Christ, Woodsfield. In addition to her parents, Mary Edith was preceded in death by five brothers, Lester, Chalmer, Ira, Robert and Don Hendershot; and a sister, Berdina Hendershot. Surviving are several nieces and nephews. Friends may call on Sunday from noon to 8 p.m. at the Harper Funeral Home, Beallsville, where services will be held on Monday at 1 p.m. Burial will follow in Beallsville Cemetery.

She was born January. 18, 1910, in Monroe County, a daughter of the late Isaac and Lottie Schnegg Hendershot.
She was a member of the Church of Christ, Woodsfield.

Hannibal
 
Hendricks, Pearl Elizabeth, nee Klingbert
Source--Marietta Times Marietta, Ohio
Published--January 28, 2005
NEWPORT, Ohio - Pearle Elizabeth Hendricks, 89, of Newport passed away Thursday , January 27, 2005 after an extended illness at the Marietta Nursing and Rehabilitation Center. She was born February 16, 1915, in Elmo, Kansas, a daughter of Dr. William A. Klingberg and Viola Garver Klingbert. She married Ralph E. Hendricks in 1941 and lived in Newport, where Ralph owned the Newport Lumber Company and Swan Lumber in Marietta. Ralph died in 1981. Pearle graduated from Hope High School in Hope, Kansas. She entered the University of Kansas in nursing, later graduating from the Kahler School of Nursing associated with the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota. She was a member of the Newport United Methodist Church, and a 52-year member of the Eastern Star in New Matamoras, Ohio. She enjoyed sports of all kinds, and was very active in her community. She also enjoyed the Rook Club in Newport. Surviving are her three children, John Hendricks and his wife, Charlotte, of Marietta, Ohio, Richard Hendricks and his wife, Peggy, of Belmont, West Virginia , and JoAnn Coates and her husband, Stan, of Canton, Ohio; eight grandchildren, Susan Adams, Jamie Snow, Brian and Jason Guthrie, Scott and Todd Hendricks, and Joshua and Bobby Coates; one great-grandson, Oliver Hendricks; one brother, Frank Klingbert of Carbondale, Illinois; and several nieces, nephews, great-nieces, and great-nephews. Pearle is preceded in death by her husband; a daughter, Connie Snow; a brother; and a sister. Services will be held at 2:30 p.m. Sunday , January 30, 2005 at the Newport United Methodist Church in Newport with the Reverend Steven M. Smith officiating. Burial will be in the Newport Cemetery at Newport. Calling hours are from 3 to 5 and 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday at the Ingram Funeral Home in Saint Marys, West Virginia, and from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Sunday at the church. An Eastern Star memorial service will be held at 8 p.m. Saturday evening at the funeral home.
 
Hendrix, Hollie residence: Woodsfield enlistment: 1918 May 27 b.p.: Perry Twp. born: 1895 Mar 23
 
Hennen, C Gay Rice
Source--Wetzel County Message Board West Virginia
Published--February 2004
C Gay Rice Hennen, 80, of Fairmont, West Virginia died Wednesday, February 25, 2004 in the Arbors at Fairmont Nursing Home.
She was born November 3, 1923 at Piney, West Virginia, a daughter of the late Jesse Lee Haught and Della May Davis Haught.
Mrs. Hennen worked as a cook at the Miss Blue Restaurant and the Earl Kiger American Legion Post number 120, both in Hundred. She was a member of the Disabled American Veterans in Waynesburg, Pennsylvania. She was known throughout the community for donating her time and services for several years. She was a protestant by faith.
Surviving are one daughter, Dixie Rice, of Fairmont; two sons & daughter in laws, Gene & Alice Rice of Fairmont and Jerry Lee and Kim Rice of Mannington; four grandchildren, three great-grandchildren; one brother, Lloyd Haught of Middlebourne; five sisters, May Haught of Sardis, Ohio, Faye Webb of Spencer, West Virginia, Reva Shanholtzer of Reader, Joy Condit of Moundsville, and Ruthetta Staley of Reader; several nieces and nephews.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her first husband, Jefferson Usky (Buck) Rice, her second husband, Fred Hennen; one son, Donnie Rice; and two brothers, Guy Haught and Terry Lee Haught.
Friends may call at the Tennant Funeral Home in Hundred from 2-4 & 7-9 p.m. Friday. Funeral services will be held in the funeral home at 11:00 a.m. Saturday with the Evangelist Steve Stevens officiating. Interment will follow in the Thomas Cemetery, Ned, Pennsylvania.

Henry, Glen R.
Source--Wetzel Chronical West Virginia
Published August 14, 2002
Glen R. Henry, 69, of HC 60, New Martinsville, died Friday, August 9, 2002, in the
University of Pittsburgh Medical Center, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania.
He was born June 17, 1933 in Friendship, West Virginia., a son of the late John W. and Clina Fitzsimmons
Henry. He was retired from Ormet Corporation, Hannibal, Ohio; a Scottish Rite 32nd Degree Mason; a member of Masonic Lodge 39 A.F.& A.M. ., Osirus Shrine Temple of Wheeling; Moose Lodge 931 and a Moose
Legionnaire; a member of Saint Johns United Methodist Church, New Martinsville; and an Army
Veteran of the Korean conflict.
In addition to his parents, he was preceded in death by a brother, John Everett Henry and a sister,
Bernice Goddard.
Survivors include: his wife, Eleanor Walton Henry; two sons, David Henry at home and Phillip Henry
and his wife, Donna, of Cool Ridge, West Virginia; a brother, Dale F. Henry and his wife, Frankie of Paden
City; a sister, Elizabeth Miller and her husband, Don, of Paden City; four grandchildren, John and
Margo Smith, Chris and Curtis Henry.
Family received friends from 12-3 p.m. and 7-9 p.m. Sunday at Grisell Funeral Home, 751 Third
Street, New Martinsville, West Virginia where services were held at 1 p.m. Monday with the Reverend Bryan Carpenter officiating. Interment in the Greenlawn Memorial Park, New Martinsville, West Virginia.
Wetzel Chronicle Wednesday, August 14, 2002

Henthorn, Adam Henthorn
 
 
February 29, 1920
 
 
Henthorn, Anna E. Henthorn
 
 
July 20, 1925
 
 
Henthorn, Anna
Published--The Spirit of Democracy Woodsfield, Ohio
June 13, 1918
Anna Henthorn, aged 48 years, an inmate of the County infirmery, died at that institution June 9 from pulmonary tuberculosis. She had been an inmate at that place since she was eleven years old, and up to within the last year had always been a hard worker and took great pride in helping to keep the home clean and in order. About eight years ago she had the misfortune to be compelled to have one of her limbs amputated at the knee but she kept right on at her work until about six months ago when that fatal disease fastened its grip on her from which all the medical aid that could be secured for her, could not be loosened. She will be sadly missed by the other inmates.
Funeral services were held by the Infirmary Pastor, W.C. Loper and burial at the infirmary cemetery, june 10, 1918.

Henthorn, Clifford L.
1929
 
Engagement
Henthorn, Cody Wyatt and Rachel Ann Reich
Source--Monroe County Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--Thursday, July 17, 2004
Larry and Glenda Reich of Woodsfield announce the approaching marriage of their daughter, Rachel Ann, to Cody Wyatt Henthorn, son of Mark and Cindy Henthorn, also of Woodsfield.
The bride-to-be is a 1999 graduate of Monroe Central High School and received a bachelor's degree in social services from Ohio University in 2003. She is employed by Northwood Health Systems as a targeted case manager.
Her fiance is a 2001 graduate of Shadyside High School and will receive an associate's degree in automotive diesel technology services from Washington State Community College in 2005.
The couple will be married July 31 at the Woodsfield Church of Christ.

Henthorn, Elmer Henthorn
 
 
March 12, 1928
 
Henthorn, Eska, nee Eickleberry
Published-- January 2000
Henthorn, Eska Eikleberry, 105, of Norfolk, West Virginia, formerly of Gilliam, West Virginia, died January 20, 2000 at the home of her daughter, Betty Lodolo, Northfork, following a lingering illness. She was born September, 1894, near Antioch, the daughter of the late Albert L. and Lenorah Smith Eickleberry.
She was a former member of The Unity Baptist Church before transferring her membership to The Northfork Baptist Church in 1923, where she actively served in various offices in the church and for the women's society. She was a member of The Keystone-Northfork Women's Club, The Garden Club and was active in Girl Scout activities. She was a resident of McDowell County since 1915.
Surviving are three daughters, Mrs. Aldo (Betty) Lodolo, Northfork, Mrs. Edwin (Mary) Dye, Marietta, Georgia, Mrs. Hillary (Ruth) Hutchens, Burlington, N.C.; a son, Don Henthorn,
and wife Virginia, of Athens, West Virginia;13 grandchildren; 17 great-grandchildren; four great-great-grandchildren ; several nieces and nephews.
In addition to her parents, she was preceded in death by her husband, Harry A. Henthorn, Sr.; a son , Harry "Cotton" Henthorn, Jr.; a sister , Mrs. Ernest (Caroline) Brown, Sardis.
Friends were received at The Bennett-Widener Funeral Home, Northfork, January 22. Funeral services were at The Northfork Baptist Church, Northfork, with the Rev. John Sprouse, pastor of The Keystone Baptist Church and John Haun officiating. Burial followed at Woodlawn Memorial Park, Bluewell.
Mrs. Henthorn was an aunt of Paul R. Brown, Woodsfield and Jess Brown, Sardis. She visited several weeks each summer with The Browns while health permitted.

Henthorn, Grace L., nee Morris
Source--Memory Card
In Memory of Grace L. Henthorn
Date of Birth April 16, 1922
Date of Death January 30, 2002
Service 1 p.m. Friday, February 1, 2002
Bauer-Turner Funeral Home
Minister Warren Kinney
Interment West Union Cemetery
Henthorn, Grace L., nee Morris
April 16, 1922
January 30, 2002
Sardis
Source:Marietta Times . . Marietta, OH . . January 2002 . .
Sardis - Grace L. Henthorn, 79, of Township 512, Sardis, died Wednesday (January 30, 2002) at her home.
She was born April 16, 1922, in Belmont County, Ohio, to Dory and Luetta Wickham Morris. She was a member of Brownsville Church of Christ.
She is survived by her husband, Lloyd Henthorn of Sardis, whom she married 55 years ago; one son, Paul Henthorn of Sardis; four daughters, Sara Huff of Hayesville, Ohio, Millie Haney of Sardis, and Marlene Terwilliger and Shirley McCaslin, both of Woodsfield; two brothers, Freeman Morris of Sardis and Chester Morris of Oklahoma; four sisters, Beulah Crawford of Summerfield, Gladys Salisbury of Sardis, Mary Riggs of New Matamoras and Ellen Nolan of North Carolina; 12 grandchildren; 18 great-grandchildren; and one great-great-grandson.
She was preceded in death by her parents and one brother, Clyde Morris.
Services are at 1 p.m. Friday at Bauer-Turner Funeral Home, 100 S. Paul St., Woodsfield, with Minister Warren Kinney officiating. Burial is in West Union Cemetery near Sardis. Friends will be received from 2 to 9 p.m. today at the funeral home.

Henthorn, Kermit
Source--Monroe Co. Beacon Woodsfield, Ohio
Published--April 2001
Kermit I. Henthorn,52, Spring Street, Woodsfield, died April 3, 2001, in Wheeling Hospital. He was born in Monroe County, March 9, 1949, a son of Margaret Craig Henthorn and the late Carl Henthorn.
He was the owner and operator of Henthorn Lanes, Woodsfield, a member of The Eagles Lodge and a social member of The Woodsfield VFW.
Surviving in addition to his mother, are his wife, Janet Bell Henthorn; three daughters, Mrs. David (Heather) Saffle, Woodsfield , Mrs. Barry (Stacey) West, Jerusalem, Trish Henthorn of the home; three brothers, Wayne Henthorn and Vernon Henthorn, both of Woodsfield, Jim Henthorn, Lewisville; two sisters, Florence (Jean) Dawson, New Martinsville and Sherry Wilson, Miltonsburg; two grandsons, Justin and Chase Saffle.
In addition to his father he was preceded in death by a brother, Lonnie Henthorn in 1990.
Friends were received April 6 at Bauer and Turner Funeral Home, Woodsfield, where services were held April 7, with Minister Keith Jones officiating.
Interment will be held at the convience of the family.
